title: WHAT'S NEW | AreaSync
content:
# üí°WHAT'S NEW

Something's cooking... üç≥

## 2.57.0 (2026-02-12)

### New Features

**Updated Power BI Template** ‚Äì The Power BI template has been updated and now contains an integration with the project program; objects coloring has also been improved.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FUM4xQs0iBaYc8xbqYbyq%252Fimage%2520%282%29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D75727049-949c-489f-94ea-0b609e529d50&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9e44f2cc&sv=2)

**Move Models Between Projects** ‚Äì You can now move models from one project to another through a guided workflow. This makes it easy to reorganize your work when project structures change, or models were accidentally uploaded to the wrong place.

<https://areasync.perkinswill.com/models/move>

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FuyhnnuquuuRWwAOk0J5n%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D57ed0521-42ee-434f-a97a-148531af4a7f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=df5aa0d&sv=2)

**Export Dashboard to Excel** ‚Äì Program dashboards can now be exported to Excel spreadsheets with full formatting, color coding, and all the calculations intact. Perfect for sharing program data with stakeholders who prefer working in Excel.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F4SeyvB4flfCnCSk34ok3%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dcabd4731-8407-403d-aad2-9be729c152eb&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=be1f0c2d&sv=2)

**Enhanced Theme Customization** ‚Äì The app now offers more theme options including additional color choices (amber, rose, sky, indigo) and an improved theme picker interface that lets you customize both light/dark mode and accent colors.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fyt7qaLJPR0TCSuEQQtaD%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5f1f4fe3-b78e-467d-b101-aaa24e96120f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ff807ca7&sv=2)

**Version Information in UI** ‚Äì The app now displays its current version number, making it easier to confirm you're running the latest release or troubleshoot version-specific issues.

### Improvements

**Faster Program Comparison Tables** ‚Äì Comparison tables now use virtualization, which means they load and scroll much more smoothly even when viewing large programs with hundreds or thousands of items.

**Program and Geometry Improvements** ‚Äì Enhanced how the Revit plugin handles 3D geometry, improving reliability when working with complex models and performing operations like assigning program items.

**Better Analytics** ‚Äì Behind-the-scenes improvements to how we track usage patterns and performance, helping us understand what features matter most and where to focus future improvements.

**Cleaner Visual Feedback** ‚Äì Removed some redundant status messages and polished the overall look and feel of various screens throughout the app.

### Bug Fixes

**Fixed Solid Display Issues** ‚Äì Resolved a problem in the Revit plugin where certain geometry wasn't displaying correctly in visualization modes.

title: AreaSync Data Connection | AreaSync
content:
# AreaSync Data Connection

Connecting to your project data is fast and easy.

For getting specific visuals or counts/quantities from your Revit data, you'll want to connect your AreaSync project data to a PowerBi report using our [PowerBi template file on Sharepoint](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8). Please [download the current template file every time you start a new project](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8), as we are always making improvements to this file.
If you want to get inspired by previous PowerBI reports done with AreaSync please visit [Palette](https://hub.perkinswill.com/6674046efd586212619aa8dd/search/668fab6edbf358e672f46b9d/examples) page.

## What's new in PowerBI template?

## Export to PowerBi

Option 1:
From your AreaSync project (web or Revit), select the Copy Query option. This really just copies a special token to directly connect with the [PowerBi template file](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FgzloYFRfC4oOCyDI6E9c%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D60ea60dd-5e0d-44d4-b4a1-e0569fea7318&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=69b02ab3&sv=2)

Option 2:
From Project Home Page click on Info button next to the sync:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FzkuFm2I5J8AZgVDSNZYO%252Finfo.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8afea77e-9cfb-4b49-8df8-2e7e45abff40&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d03bd146&sv=2)

Click on the Info button next to specifc sync

Then Copy PowerBI Query, optionally you can also select specific parameters that you would like to see in PowerBI (by default all parameters will be visible if none was selected).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F95XVnweFjGDg9aEXb3gp%252Fcopypowerquery.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D93da9327-ea2c-4cfb-bcd2-55163fe5feec&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6ed5b6d7&sv=2)

Copy PowerBI Query

## Open the PBIT Template.

To start a file from a PowerBi template, you can Download the latest template from here:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FaahKxfz5DqRZCcdfIikX%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5326bbb2-b5f3-4cf4-8ad8-7ac56bf3fe89&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=b7255090&sv=2)

Then Open PowerBI desktop on your PC. Click on Open -> Browse this device - > *navigate to template file from downloads* -> Open

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FezUDY6wHLLE9FTIMASmU%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df3534e69-7926-4142-a7c3-e4b63a8c13e7&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f624e9df&sv=2)

After opening please be patient, it takes a second to load :)

## Paste the query

When the template opens, the dialog will prompt you for a token. Paste (CTRL+V) the value and click Load.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FHtuzjJQlZkcciZTQmUHL%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da2507370-02c6-430a-a765-5e06a2cfd7f6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=586bcc3c&sv=2)

## View your project data

The PowerBI template contains 3 pages: Areas, Rooms and Assets. In the Room page, when your project loads, it should look something like this but showing the room department and level names of your current project. The bar chart, donut chart, and table all breakdown the room areas by department.

#### [This template is a starting point](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/DigitalPracticeFiles/IQBx9unSk2WDSZTiuOpY9_mjASi1uZW1jnaO9U-mHEKEGI4?e=zZINET) for how you want to look at your project data. Organize it the way that makes sense to you and your team. The possibilities are endless.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FYSdyMsCQ6gEloIW8IMku%252FColors%2520example.jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0e3435dc-dfde-48f6-8900-81669c1dce58&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f6c952a5&sv=2)

If you wish to visualize Assets Catalog please get the template from [here](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/DigitalPracticeFiles/ERG7Jdn8Xp9IlNdplFHGEIsB6SkTd9VSnccvpTe1TQMznw?e=qo7DGe).

[Read more about adding pictures to Assets (that are reused in PowerBI).](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/schedules)

## Save your file

Now that you have successfully created a PowerBi file from the template, go ahead and save it somewhere to your hard drive or a Teams folder. Later on, when you have things looking good, you'll want to publish this file to a Workspace so it can be made accessible to other team members. More on that later.

## Troubleshooting

If you get errors after loading the project, it might be solved by configuring your privacy settings. You'll need to do this the first time you work with AreaSync in PowerBi, and won't need to do it again until your next laptop. Go to File > Options, and set like the image below. After that, click Refresh to load.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FLLh7XWKbIJ5owWDmY92j%252FAreaSync2_Privacy%2520Settings.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D81aab221-43be-4165-8e9d-9bf4733e83b3&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d75aa1a9&sv=2)

## I had setup PowerBI but nothing is loading after a while.

The authentication token expires after a month. If the queries are not loading its probably because the authtoken from the Query Input have expired. In that case we need to refresh the AuthToken in Query Input.

1. To fix that, go to your AreaSync Project and [copy the query again.](/areasync/power-bi/areasync-data-connection#export-to-powerbi)
2. Open Notepad or any application where you can paste the copied value to.
3. In broken PowerBI go to Transform Data -> Query Input -> *copy the value from there and paste it into Notepad as well*

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F1FACGan5P8LHLxmNdDnJ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De962f158-54bd-43d3-a24a-c95449e0739d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=520f854f&sv=2)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FMvl8XMJBOpmkAaNChE5p%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9843aa1f-1fa0-43c9-820e-099146fb7e9d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c0de2d74&sv=2)

1. Copy paste the value for Authtoken from new query into the old one

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F7QGV4RQbWlJt8Y0rikpm%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbf67151c-938c-4640-a043-ccb39741b443&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=a972d827&sv=2)

1. Copy the update OLD query and paste it into Query Input in PowerBI:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FRdIgJ7eZJRbZ5tdzcuPd%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Daa195691-5c04-4afb-ab98-fac92838564a&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=13d8358c&sv=2)

1. Click Close and Apply

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FkCArk5MAg9QurZuqxn7J%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dad4da5fc-84c6-48b8-9da0-94aa18f0baac&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=bd8e363&sv=2)

1. The PowerBI should refresh now - if that still didn't happen please contact Digital Practice member

## When I load my PowerBI for the first time, it shows an error that "X of loaded quaries contained Error"

The error looks like this:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FW0TSLXOi115nWsPXkFw2%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D701a93d6-0e6e-4751-9515-34ebeb933667&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f86d227&sv=2)

On this particular error you can just click on Close and the query should load regadless of it.
It is related to the fact that maybe your sync does not contain either Rooms, Areas, Assets, Colors etc. PowerBI template is prepared to handle it however it still throws an error.

## Still having trouble?

If you still have trouble being able to load your project into the template, please reach out to your DA or on [the Spatial and Data Analysis channel on the MS Digital Practice Team](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/channel/19%3A9f625955f1e34681aa6e4b7adb16e166%40thread.skype/Spatial%20and%20Data%20Analytics?groupId=ac84d985-c4f9-406d-9e5f-0487656c2178&tenantId=0669333e-dace-48e9-86a7-f105c21644e1). Someone will be available to assist you.

title: PowerBI AreaSync Viewer | AreaSync
content:
# PowerBI AreaSync Viewer

Display Rooms, Areas and Assets in PowerBI with AreaSync Visual

## Viewer Functions Overview

In general, Viewer has 4 display options: Top View, 3D view, Top View all levels and Exploded Axo. There is also a possibility of displaying Assets on the Viewer. Please be mindful that 3D view displays 2D floorplans.

Below is a quick overview of the intended functionality of this function:

### Top View

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhcmkgslUHBkuX2XQ8bex%252Ftopview.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D08f6ccd4-a5f5-45a3-95e6-97c6e17067c2&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d7b96178&sv=2)

Top View is useful to view specific levels, use it with slicer

### 3D View

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FCLGf2H5ZnBB37hfA3viW%252F3D%2520view.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da697a1ce-d889-4ab6-9281-6950a82b66b6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2d63f6eb&sv=2)

Default 3D View - useful for displaying entire building

### Top View all levels

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FPYNnRCWKZ0C6RZLAPoec%252Ftopalllevels.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9277b9a9-64ad-486f-b5c4-f68c66e62516&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1a944594&sv=2)

View to see all levels 2D

### Exploded Axo

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fp6b7bEZsnDSQEXFK9hJ6%252Fexploded%2520axo.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dba917f20-7278-47dd-952e-fdeeef92b5b5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c66e4caf&sv=2)

Exploded Axo has also adjustable distances between levels

### Displaying Assets location

When assets are shown as "dots" in rooms, zooming out displays a single dot per room with a count indicating the number of assets present. As you zoom in, these dots separate to represent individual assets within space:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FLNFpwoZpMvAF5nuBdW6S%252FAssets11.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6507e949-3b58-4918-8bc5-e54aaae1c969&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2964de27&sv=2)

Assets per room

### Viewer Inputs overview

The Viewer takes following inputs (fields in Bold are minimum req. for Visual to work):

* **Element Id** - Id of elements that we want to display. If we want to display both Rooms and Areas or Rooms and Assets we need to have a table that combines Ids of both.
* **Level** - this normally contains the Level Name - so we can sort and display by specific Level Name
* **Geometry** - contains the string specifying points to display the geometry, again we need to have merged table if we want to display multiple elements
* **Is Context** - its TRUE/FALSE parameter to let the visual know which elements should be displayed on top. It is used for multi-element display.
* **Parent Id** - sets a relationship between Asset and Rooms, input is normally "roomId" from Assets table. Required if we want to display Assets.
* **Color by** - if we want to color by specific parameter value we can use this field, like "Department" or "Family and Type". This color is random by respecting parameter value.
* **Color** - specific HEX value we want to color the visual by.
* **Element Data -** additional data that will be displayed per element on the tooltip once selected**.** It enables selection of values on other visuals (like table or slicer) and displays the selection on the Visual.

Example setup for Assets Visual, all coming from Table "RoomsAssets":

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FuGwuf3ccMIBZYwMqT8WP%252F2025-02-04_14h51_29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D34ae1668-40e8-432b-8256-03ce743d25fb&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ecadbc2&sv=2)

Inputs for Assets display

Capturing Design Data

With the click of a button, AreaSync Revit add-in captures a wealth of information about your design in its current state, sending all data to a cloud database for easy access. title: Getting Started | AreaSync
content:
# Getting Started

follow this steps to install and access AreaSync.

## Installation

To install **Area Sync Rhino**, go through the following steps:

1. Open the Rhino **Package Manager** by typing the command `PackageManager` or through the top bar menu.
2. Search for `AreaSync`
   *If AreaSyncRhino is not showing up on the search, please follow the guide below.*
3. Choose the latest version, or any older if that‚Äôs the case.
4. Press install.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F0OnDsWBxufvBRMyzsPFS%252FINSTALL.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dda611ba3-7cd7-4bb9-9d14-17c10d93581c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=cd5b1f6&sv=2)

Install AreaSync through Package Manager

## AreaSync did NOT show up in PackageManager?

Setup the Perkins&Will Rhino Package Manager

1. Open the options panel using the `Options` command.
2. Navigate to the `Advanced` section on the left menu.
3. Type PackageManager on the search bar.
4. Double-click the ‚ÄúValue‚Äù.
5. Make sure to include **‚Äú;S:\Yak‚Äù** to the end of the sources

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fr8SMdhgcmQAQWBo0HXr8%252Fyak.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D14b90e92-86f7-4ac1-8c20-d49e14b25f5d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7cdeddc1&sv=2)

## Did the install work?

Make sure the installation worked by opening the Area Sync panel using the `AreaSyncRhinoPanel` command.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FJt4dF65lxeo8xuFJgwaJ%252Fdiditwork.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db3c04e50-d66e-4b5b-8b5a-b571a95ef7fb&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5a3288fb&sv=2)

If you can see the AreaSync panel, you‚Äôre ready to get started :)

## AreaSync installed in Rhino 8 but still not working?

If you are getting this error:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FOJu3cpnpsDy0La1Qxkq8%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3a8fafd2-e789-4107-99fd-ec8901fff455&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=98bdf2e2&sv=2)

Try this steps:

1. Start Rhino
2. Type the command **SetDotNetRuntime**
3. Select the **Runtime** option
4. Set the **NETCore** option
5. Close Rhino
6. Reopen Rhino, AreaSync should be loaded in.

## Logging in for the first time

After installing AreaSync you will be asked to log in:

1. Log in with your Microsoft Account
2. Select your Project (**if your Project is not visible reach out to your local Digital Practice to add you to it**)

title: Excel Program Integration | AreaSync
content:
# Excel Program Integration

Compare the actual area from Revit with the targets from Excel

While every project seems to format their program data differently in an Excel file, the Power Query interface inside PowerBi Desktop has ways of getting to the 'clean data' using some typical commands. Here, we will give some guidance on how to structure the columns in excel to make the process cleaning the data easier. You can also use your Program directly in AreaSync, please follow [this](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/program) steps.

## Guidelines for Excel

There are two major guidelines you want to implement in your excel program.

1. **Use a column or set of columns for Space Code** that designates the type of space. This will also be used in a Revit room parameter, and will ultimately be used to match the actual area from Revit to the target area coming from Excel. The format of the code doesn't matter as long as it matches the values being input into Revit. Some like to use multiple columns for department, subdepartment, and room. In PowerBi (Power Query), we can combine these multiple columns into a single column, and even place a dot or dash between them if needed.
2. **Use separate columns for Department, Sub-department, and Rooms.** Indent them very closely if you want to make them look stacked.
3. **Have a single header row that clearly labels each column.** This can be separate from other headers you're using and can be hidden (if needed).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F3qhIbQRmnbk8qDGikUZN%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6df7cbf1-772b-4e1d-86f4-1162c2e77d71&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c5126605&sv=2)

Separate columns to help organize the data

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FBpv9alZvjVHJlQI8Cv4J%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D29274bf3-32e4-4e3f-89ff-b0b38a4d42d1&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=71e6795f&sv=2)

Header row can be minimized or hidden. You can also use separate columns for department, subdepartment, and room instead of a single column for this.

## Importing Excel data into PowerBi

While there are going to be many different versions of programming excel files being used across the firm, the steps shown here should be directly applicable to most cases where the above guidelines are being implemented in some way. It is highly recommended to import data from Sharepoint (Teams) excel files, and to directly import the one that is being edited (not a copy). Don't worry, Sharepoint has all the backups you need.

### Getting the Excel data

1. Open the Sharepoint excel file containing the program in the desktop version of Excel. Click on File > Info > Program. Click on the Copy Path button to copy the weblink to your clipboard.
   ![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FjpsI8FPHjsfqu0GNG4ve%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd827c7b1-34de-4f7e-ab5d-ac96f18911b3&width=300&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7a290ce7&sv=2)
2. In PowerBi desktop, open the file you created using the AreaSync PBIT template. On the Home tab, click on Get Data > Web.
   ![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FkbFA5iZv0It7O0FewkaK%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddf1b9b0c-3576-4515-a045-bc601754cc89&width=300&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=523b1be9&sv=2)
3. Paste in the path (CTRL+V) from your clipboard, removing everything after the '.xlsx' file extension. Click OK.
   ![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FENFWnUsDaX6LC3FdPgMt%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3fb863dc-cbda-4c5c-a21c-081a15ce2bf2&width=300&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7c964423&sv=2)
4. In the Navigator dialog, select your sheet/table and click Load.
   ![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FV7gV3msKTW7E4eQdSxTv%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D71920763-29b6-4aa6-9610-217e9420df63&width=300&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8626722e&sv=2)

content:
# PowerBI examples

Examples of custom dashboards and their use cases.

## Design Options comparison

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FGyT1f2povHsAbqdm46EE%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6c1442f6-911a-4527-be05-f58324c5b73c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=69b84afc&sv=2)

This project uses the new AreaSync feature to make comparisons of Departments and Rooms inside different Design Options. This allows the team to iterate faster and utilize AreaSync calculations at a rapid pace, removing manual updates inside Excel.

## Interior Fit-out example - assets dashboard

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F4ud8maTbliiX50xyusjA%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4fdf09ed-74fe-42cb-b967-e26602baab76&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7be8e1d2&sv=2)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F4gOxp2ZNXJhIhwSGooIJ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7718e451-bc84-456b-a71b-51ce65cf9f7e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=457a2fe0&sv=2)

In this example, rooms from Revit are integrated along with assets such as furniture, equipment, and casework. One of the report pages provides an overview of assets per specific space, allowing users to verify which elements are present in each area. The second page features a catalog with images of assets added through AreaSync, giving users a clear view of where specific assets are located and how they appear. Learn more [here.](https://hub.perkinswill.com/6674046efd586212619aa8dd/search/668fab6edbf358e672f46b9d/examples) Learn more about how to add pictures to your assets [here.](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/schedules)

## Hospital Project - Complex program comparison with Revit Rooms and areas

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FvR2tKC2zv2gOcMjzgKYO%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0b3bee6e-97b3-4807-8e0f-80c1c14daf78&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=e9f7c164&sv=2)

Leeds hospital project - the client had complex program requirements and was interested in tracking them against our design. The dashboard was shared with the client to show how ongoing planning efforts are meeting the their criteria. The feedback was very positive - instead of going through endless excel files and drawing sets client was able to get overview of ongoing design in user-friendly way. Learn more [here.](https://app.powerbi.com/groups/f1f1962f-0a34-455f-acb9-50d6aca7ebcb/reports/26c9ec56-495d-4dbf-a92e-d6f3615a56c6?ctid=0669333e-dace-48e9-86a7-f105c21644e1&pbi_source=linkShare)

## Pursuit - visualize Areas and stacking

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FLoAZG0JYGobyv6XK1Iu6%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D60ca1fb2-4c48-4943-9568-f404f1c6f39f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2d0802a0&sv=2)

This is an example of early study of spaces for multi-building pursuit. It combines different types of metrics that client had requested and they are all combined in one dashboard that was delivered as part of pursuit. Download the dashboard [here](https://app.powerbi.com/groups/f1f1962f-0a34-455f-acb9-50d6aca7ebcb/reports/297df588-22cd-4789-a636-191eb5a5ffd6/764529329b0760e30a04?experience=power-bi).

## State Street - multi-model example

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FjEEs9mFvn3cvDZVD1QFl%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De1ebde63-8500-459d-bba2-6956ff2ee0cc&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=31bee12b&sv=2)

In London Office, most of projects are split in Revit to accommodate File Size Requirements, this mean we have a separate model which are determined by 'Zones' in the example Z1, Z2 and Z3 (ISO 19650 Naming). We then link these separate files into a Documents Model where we produce our sheets. In Area Sync, we can quite quickly visualize which model the rooms live. Learn more [here.](https://hub.perkinswill.com/6674046efd586212619aa8dd/search/668fab6edbf358e672f46b9d/examples)

## K-12 Example - spaces from Revit mapped with program in Excel

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F29slMM0MbtxyHAq0ruaf%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Deab8fdd7-6c46-4251-94cc-fef660ade05c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=e8a255c3&sv=2)

In this example, there are room elements coming from Revit and programming info from excel. One of the report pages has a comparison to validate the program. There is also an integration between the spatial data and the Speckle viewer. Download the pbix file [here.](https://hub.perkinswill.com/6674046efd586212619aa8dd/search/668fab6edbf358e672f46b9d/examples)

title: Schedules | AreaSync
content:
# Schedules

Schedules provide an overview of specific assets, rooms, or areas within your project.

They are fully customizable and can display information from multiple models. The best part is that even in multimodal projects, schedules clearly show the connection between an asset and the room it belongs to, helping you understand their relationship. Additionally, they are useful for team members who don‚Äôt use design software but need a quick way to check quantities for specific assets or spaces.

Project can have many schedules and they are visible and editable by all users.

To access Schedules click on Schedules page, in order to create new one click on Add Schedule:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNTd36Tl3d9zgqkleNW8B%252F2025-01-30_13h16_58.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D791b6031-d437-4525-b733-ca5a651ae6c6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=882d7148&sv=2)

Add a Schedule

To setup a schedule you need to:

* Choose whether it should be a schedule for Rooms, Areas, or Assets.
* Select the appropriate models to include.
* Assign a name to the schedule.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FEzVynD7Av7U1yFZOswxW%252F2025-01-30_14h08_44.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db78f6404-9364-443e-a001-61ce8806af3f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=fc81e36c&sv=2)

Basic Schedule setup

The schedule is configured to include assets from two models, and we can complete the process by clicking the Create button.
On Schedules main page we have a quick overview of what specific schedule actually includes.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FmsFtKDCzv0bqQv7oAPxr%252F2025-01-30_14h21_01.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De8bf36f2-89ec-42b5-b955-84094761b7c5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=852bb2fc&sv=2)

Overview of schedule contents

## Schedule Functions Overview

In left corner over the schedule you can see total number of instances and what type of schedule is that.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FV5eU5IeMDnPH3PkrjEGJ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De9199aac-f8c7-4364-952d-17bcb563915e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d296afe&sv=2)

Schedule overview: number of elements in the schedule

Generally, schedules include functions like:

* **Search** - function to find specific element - searches through all parameter values
* **Columns** - add columns (by parameter) to your Schedule
* **Group By** - groups components based on the same parameter value (it will display total count of these elements on each row)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F2pTIVlVESkQjX0AHycw0%252F2025-01-30_15h14_18.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D007431c1-8fb4-4af4-938e-1e8c7d81eff2&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ca6b3667&sv=2)

Group by parameter value

* **Save settings** - saves the current state of a schedule (other users will also see this state)
* **Edit schedule settings** - takes you back to original setting page (useful if we need to add a new model)
* **See All Schedules** - takes you back to main Schedules page
* **Share - Copy Link** - copies link to this schedule
* **Share - Exce**l - exports the schedule to Excel. Exports do NOT persist Group By if it was added to the schedule

## Filtering by parameter value

You can also filter by column value by clicking on three dots and choosing specific values:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F2pTIVlVESkQjX0AHycw0%252F2025-01-30_15h14_18.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D007431c1-8fb4-4af4-938e-1e8c7d81eff2&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ca6b3667&sv=2)

Filtering by Parameter value

Each column where filtering is applied will be marked like this:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F8w0FHcFZapezavsXFywR%252F2025-01-30_15h16_57.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9eac9bfb-5d31-415a-b6ff-6dda968b0089&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=134ec422&sv=2)

Column Filtering

## Magic columns in Assets Schedule

There are three columns that exist in AreaSync (but not in Revit):

* **Is Linked** - indicates if the elements comes from linked file or not
* **Space** - name and number of the Room the element belongs to. Works also if elements are separate from model where rooms are (but the space model is linked in and sync was done with Links option included)
* Image - here you can drag and drop a picture of an asset. Once you drop the picture all assets of same Family and Type will be populated. Later, you are able to reuse this pictures in PowerBI or Excel:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FQc8ooe4guKnSzV15o3WH%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2154f2d0-82c7-4801-b3eb-5563d67c6435&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=aa394b87&sv=2)

How to add a picture to Asset?

Example of reusing the pictures from AreaSync in PowerBi:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FzFLSUh2tUXN9MeapybbT%252Fcata%25C3%25A6log.jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D765ba264-9128-4205-8aa8-066111a13569&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4d9ded28&sv=2)

Furniture Catalog in PowerBI

# Using the AreaSync Rhino Plugin

Generally, there are two different getting started scenarios no matter if you work with 3D models or 2D plans:

1. (Some) geometry is already modelled in Rhino and we want to start tracking spaces.
2. We received a program (Excel) from a client and want to start planning our spaces based on this criteria.

The diagram below highlights steps for both scenarios. Ultimately no matter which scenario we start with it leads to the same result.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FEPhvPVSyQU3ZlPUQ9Io1%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9a4e8f06-55b4-4099-b0a6-0cc9be9eac8e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=609ca31c&sv=2)

title: Start tracking Rooms | AreaSync
content:
# Start tracking Rooms

Before anything, think about what parameters the client or your team wants to keep control. Some examples are if you want to break your program in departments, or space functions, if they are public or not, how many desks a space need to fit.

## Define your parameters

Click on **Start Setup** and let‚Äôs start by defining the parameters we will keep track for this project. Parameter requires a name and a data type. AreaSync supports 4 data types of parameters:

* Text ‚Äì Useful to give name to things, or specify details.
* Number ‚Äì Assign quantities, minimums, maximums, targets, etc.
* Yes/no ‚Äì Specify ‚Äútrue/yes‚Äù or ‚Äúfalse/no‚Äù conditions.
* Category ‚Äì Classify things like departments, type of buildings, type of space, etc.

Parameters of type *Category* require a set of values (or classes) to categorize them. You can also assign colors for each category and add targets (normally targets are assigned per instance, but category type of parameter allows us to assign targets to group of instances e.g. Department).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FW3cMaKnO5Ert2RjlxN0C%252FAddParamrs.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddfadb229-b935-4538-94d8-67c58786ed62&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9ba2ec13&sv=2)

There are some parameters that are added to each room automatically:

* Name - name of the space/room (editable)
* Target Area - area in program (editable)
* Area - actual modelled area (non-editable)
* Coverage - % difference between **Target Area** and **Area**  (non-editable)

Alternatively, you can select parameters from preset. There are two presets available:

* Annual-Energy-Use - parameters needed for energy analysis
* AreaSync Revit - same parameters as the once available in the Revit template. This is recommended if you do not have requirements from the client and know that this project will be at some point moving to Revit.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F7lTXFYzpiZFhYC1QZPhk%252FAddParamrsSETUP.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc9b1ec2a-5edd-4028-ae87-81bd5abe34a7&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f865a42b&sv=2)

## Assign parameters to geometry

Lets apply our parameter set to our volumes geometry in Rhino. You just need to select the geometries you want to be considered as rooms or spaces and click *Select Geometry*.

You can select multiple geometries at once.

Review your rooms in the *Table* to make sure the values are assigned correctly.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F4uyDwCpqXAPicHmkckJC%252FAssignaparams.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dda5d1256-90e5-4702-bf6b-49cef987a894&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9c5810cd&sv=2)

The values can always be edited either on *Home Page* or through the *Table.* You can change values for multiple Spaces at once:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FVwy9JZtcPlbUlC1ZWtyh%252Fedit%2520param%2520values.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D03997748-f863-4eb0-ae8a-d24f39c9fb8f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5ddef229&sv=2)

title: Troubleshooting of Rhino plugin | AreaSync
content:
# Troubleshooting of Rhino plugin

Resolutions for common issues with Rhino Plugin

## Plugin is installed, but it is not loading in Rhino

If you get this error on startup of Rhino:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FOR0DxSC2WcAa6Cpn8fPa%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D500f7ae5-dbd3-4d02-bd83-9ab32c71dc0b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4820536e&sv=2)

It is likely that you have multiple AreaSync Rhino plugins installed.

1. Save and Close Rhino
2. Go to this path:

%appdata%\McNeel\Rhinoceros\packages\8.0
%appdata%\McNeel\Rhinoceros\packages\7.0

and remove all contents from it.

1. Reinstall AreaSync. Guide [here.](/areasync/rhino/getting-started)

title: Visualize your data | AreaSync
content:
# Visualize your data

## Intro

In this page we will explain Table and Visualization tabs - two places where we can review our data.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F7geZb2UgS1Rt0zivWKwO%252Fvizexplain.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db9fd0a2c-cb11-4f35-8b2d-d8d2b5724dd6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5d27114c&sv=2)

## Table tab

In the *Table* we have an overview of all rooms/spaces in the project. *Table* contains both assigned and unassigned rooms (not linked to any geometry). *Table* is interactive with the modelled geometry.

On the top left you can see the *Total* number of all rooms (instances) and *Selected* (currently selected instances of rooms).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FEehXEzb8cbBfg3R12DK2%252FTableView.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Debdb59a5-437f-4044-b799-df732a5c221e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d12b732f&sv=2)

## Unassign geometry

Unassign geometry removes the link between a room in AreaSync and instance of geometry modelled. Rooms are NOT automatically deleted from the *Table*- they stay as "empty" rooms but all parameters remain assigned. **Unassigned rooms** show as grey in the *Table*.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FLHKkY1EGPU5wQi1HEsY0%252Funassign.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De184658d-4dc2-436a-ace2-429169cac585&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=134cd0c1&sv=2)

If you want to remove **Unassigned Rooms** use *Purge* button. NOTE: to use *Purge* nothing should be selected.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FnMt2bSVowRkJDy6i3LaS%252Fpurge.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1cf4a7db-2380-4971-9a5f-cb44e161caad&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2a1e1266&sv=2)

## Edit rooms

*Edit rooms* allows us to change the parameters of the selected rooms. It is the same function as on the *Home* tab and can be used interchangeably.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FSQMBNhi7ai9GIQ1oJhh9%252FeditRooms.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D97e01950-7643-449f-bcb6-dee8d9ed2b2e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=dc73e196&sv=2)

## Select All

*Select All* simply selects all rooms in the project. To unselect click outside of the *Table.*

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FbAalxryKkXqpFrzLobLM%252Fselectall.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0fde57ab-b38b-4dac-8195-2573081e1fa4&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=40885923&sv=2)

## Filter Rooms

*Filter Rooms* allows to filter rooms in the table by parameter values. Multiple filters can be applied at once. The value of the parameter has to be typed manually but it is not case-sensitive.

To go back to default *Table* view click on *Reset*.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNeZwhpHrxH0iLp3JIjAS%252FFilterTable.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D857f60f6-8a79-4919-8167-de54fed39735&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4a840bd4&sv=2)

## Visualization tab

Here you can view summaries and charts for *Category* parameters. Both chart and table are interactive with modelled geometry.

You can also activate coloring to display the colors you assigned to the parameters and help understanding.

Clicking on the chart slices or on the table rows will quickly select the elements of that category.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FAAloPbeM8tevhNXtF4U9%252FViztab.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D70625eee-9a94-43d0-84bb-72aa90084843&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2ff0724f&sv=2)

## Target chart

This type of chart shows overview between modelled *Area* and the *Target Area* including the % of *Coverage* for specific *Category* parameter.

Switch to Target chart by clicking on the *Chart* icon.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FiYWLuF8qxpG7GOprU4BL%252Ftargetchart.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D941c6f0e-0357-435b-a6f2-af4f5c8e1a0c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6b085de1&sv=2)

## Edit Table

This is useful when you need to for instance prepare a presentation for the client focusing on specific spaces in the project.

1. Click the *Edit* icon
2. Hide/Show columns and rows
3. Click *Edit* icon to update table and save this setting.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Ftgm2irqkWStJlMz9rQ9N%252Fedittable.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D93dd0fb1-e6be-4cda-923b-198fa99bbc2b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=b7d908bb&sv=2)

## Print chart and table

If you wish to use the graphics and chart in your presentation you can always print it to PDF.

1. Click on *Print* icon
2. Chose your default printer and setup up the print.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FrmSXe6YCVJIK39d5aHHO%252Fprint.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3aa60fb4-f613-48b5-b99a-614289a667e8&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=59751e9e&sv=2)

[PreviousUpload a program from Excel and generate geometry](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/upload-a-program-from-excel-and-generate-geometry)[NextHome Tab](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/home-tab)

title: Advanced | AreaSync
content:
# Advanced

#### How to enable Experimental Features

Please note that experimental features might contain issues, so use it with caution.

To enable experimental features on Area Sync Revit, head to the installation folder: `%localAppData%\AreaSync\revit` and choose the Revit version folder you want to enable the features.

Inside that folder, look for a file called `config.json`, if that file is not there you should be able to create one just using a text editor.

```
{
  "EnableExperimentalFeatures": true
}
```

Copy and paste the content above into the configuration file and start Revit, you should see the experimental features now.

[PreviousSync Settings](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/sync-settings)[NextAREASYNC.COM](/areasync/areasync.com)

title: Using the AreaSync Revit add-in | AreaSync
content:
# Using the AreaSync Revit add-in

## The following pages will cover the various parts of the Revit add-in

title: Projects View | AreaSync
content:
# Projects View

## Accessing Your Project

#### Open the [AreaSync Projects page](https://areasync.perkinswill.com/projects), and click the Open Projects button. Use the search bar in the top right to find your project. Click on your project to continue.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FWaUd39OCl7kDuWfjfxnj%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D668cf542-c124-4dd1-916b-1ba43cc9697c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=427022fc&sv=2)

## Info on the thumbnails. Where does it come from?

**Image:** Sourced from HUB App. To replace the image change it in the PW Projects page

**Name:** Sourced from HUB App, or custom entered from someone upon project creation.

**Green Check:** This appears if linked to HUB

**Last Sync:** The most recent sync from Revit or Rhino to the PW Project Database

*Some projects will show ‚ÄúNot Synced Yet‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúLast Sync‚Äù. In those Projects there is unfortunately nothing to view. If you are part of these projects please sync!*

## Don't see your project listed? Request from Digital Practice

Reach out to your local Digital Practice team member or request in the [General Teams channel](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/channel/19%3aa75859e05414409e80374ca03832a8ce%40thread.skype/General?groupId=ac84d985-c4f9-406d-9e5f-0487656c2178&tenantId=0669333e-dace-48e9-86a7-f105c21644e1). Provide the project name/number and the people that need to be added. Once the project has been created, refresh the page and search Projects again.

[PreviousFirst time login](/areasync/areasync.com/getting-started/first-time-login)[NextNavigating AreaSync.com](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com)

title: Installation | AreaSync
content:
# Installation

AreaSync Revit pushes model information to a cloud database where it can be easily accessed by reports from PowerBi to track important design data. Information on this page will guide you through the

## IMPORTANT!

Please make sure your AreaSync is up to date. If you have a moment go to Company Portal and check the version of AreaSync avaiable there.

Please make sure that you don't have duplicated versions of AreaSync installed, especially if you are a long time user.
To make sure you have the latest version:

1. Close Revit
2. Go to **Add or remove programs** in Windows and search for AreaSync. Click on 3 dots and uninstall all versions (no admin required)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FgViUCZRAmgesXsLGu2ni%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3919467c-110d-4641-8c3e-40af3053a34c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=86e1fedf&sv=2)

1. In Uninstall window make sure to check **Delete the application data** to make sure everything is wiped out

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F4tdC3iKDLuusjFXiTuNi%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D48833ace-8170-4153-9af5-b8098230297f&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=a41e4ba8&sv=2)

1. Go to Company Portal and install newest version available there
2. Once AreaSync is installed, on AreaSync icon on toolbar right click to "Check for updates" and install them

   ![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FsJzDhhnmQ8pLMFISdEWl%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dac5efed9-c509-44eb-9b9f-c04419f33d4e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=b76e6267&sv=2)
3. Reopen Revit

## Installation

#### Revit add-in available for download in Company Portal

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FOeoj9Tf539170yTU0RBj%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd021f15b-9467-44ac-b7ba-712bb8d01115&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4db363&sv=2)

After successful installation Area Sync 2 should appear on PW tab. Everytime there is a new release AreaSync will send a notification for an update.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhAL3d3GKGIAi7K4T17Qv%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3e8bda3f-325e-4272-ac24-9cc24c853e7c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d95011bc&sv=2)

title: Upload a program from Excel and generate geometry | AreaSync
content:
# Upload a program from Excel and generate geometry

## Create simple Excel based on the Program

Make sure that the Excel you will be uploading has a simple data structure:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FagBQF9VClLoWT900wmoq%252Fexcel.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Daa54ce5b-4438-4076-b1d9-db6b229fc57a&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9af8757c&sv=2)

**Target Area**, **Count**, **Length**, **Height** and **Width** have special powers ‚Äì through Wizard function geometry will be generated based on these parameters. Make sure you add this parameters to your Excel if you have specific requirements from the project.

**Count** simply creates multiple instances of the same spaces with identical parameters**.**

## Import Excel

1. Select **Import Program** on a Startup view.
   *If you skipped the* ***Startup view****, then go to* ***Settings*** *->* ***Import Program***
2. **AreaSync** will pick up Column headers as parameters for your project. In this step we need to select a data type for each one of them.

The data types for parameters are:

* Text ‚Äì Useful to give name to things, or specify details.
* Number ‚Äì Assign quantities, minimums, maximums, targets, etc.
* Yes/no ‚Äì Specify ‚Äútrue/yes‚Äù or ‚Äúfalse/no‚Äù conditions.
* Category - this type of parameter will drive the **Visualization** tab. You can predefine values and colors associated to them. Values can be edited/added/removed later on as well.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FXrrb2aQEYwGE5Ci06EF2%252FUploadprogram.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D552e46e7-7b34-4cd4-acdf-998995159cca&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=625765d4&sv=2)

There are some parameters that are added to each room automatically:

* Name - name of the space/room (editable)
* Target Area - area in program (editable)
* Area - actual modelled area (non-editable)
* Coverage - % difference between **Target Area** and **Area**  (non-editable)

## Generate geometry through Wizard

1. Before you create the geometry make sure that the Excel had imported correctly. Go to **Table** to check out if the spaces are corresponding to your Excel.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FWXS0zqxxpHs7yu3jE5LZ%252FcompareExcels.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4b335341-8947-4f6f-8146-1ac234b61a05&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8e897cf8&sv=2)

Based on the***Count***parameter multiple *Kitchen* instances had been created in AreaSync

1. To generate the geometry go to **Settings** -> **Use Wizard.** Chose the type of geometry and its placement and click on **Create Geometry**:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fzn97dq1984V8F9z7dLpW%252Fusewizard.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da7eb46f2-9d91-4176-81ae-d8e85a2b59fa&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c5eff089&sv=2)

The full workflow:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FK2Ls8VIie58IiiIESvEt%252FGenerateGeometry.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5dd64376-6b46-4c2b-a1b6-7d59431f199b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=e2af91bd&sv=2)

Now you can start creating your model from generated geometry. You can edit the parameters and its values at any point in time as well as assign parameters to new instances that were created manually.

[PreviousStart tracking Buildings](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/start-tracking-buildings)[NextVisualize your data](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/visualize-your-data)

title: Home Tab | AreaSync
content:
# Home Tab

## Intro

This chapter will explain functions of the main *Home* tab in AreaSync. Here is the general overview of the *Home* tab:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FcBT54mIWKaL7sMGu6QQo%252Fhome%2520tab.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Daa7206ae-7adf-47dc-9e69-45c244b738e0&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9f804941&sv=2)

## Change Project

If the project in the left corner does not correspond to the project model should be related to then go to *User* icon -> *Projects* and select correct Project.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fz2XLiUlfC6HC3F8itOXO%252Fchangeproejct.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D11b02b86-95f4-448e-9d68-d9a4dda135dd&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1f06b984&sv=2)

**Don't see your project listed? Request from Digital Practice**

Reach out to your local Digital Practice team member or request in the [General Teams channel](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/channel/19%3aa75859e05414409e80374ca03832a8ce%40thread.skype/General?groupId=ac84d985-c4f9-406d-9e5f-0487656c2178&tenantId=0669333e-dace-48e9-86a7-f105c21644e1). Provide the project name/number and the people that need to be added. Once the project has been created, refresh the page and search Projects again.

## Change units

If you want to set up correct project units go to *Settings* tab -> *Units* and select correct once's.

This settings will be applied to entire project.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FWUEhFXEdKSIXXH1ZSx5E%252Funits.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db1aa3a54-8acc-47e9-8fad-d8b91cb62b68&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=e9dbfeb3&sv=2)

## Create room

*Create Room* allows to apply parameter set to our geometry in Rhino. You just need to select the geometries you want to be considered as rooms or spaces and click *Select Geometry*.

You can select multiple geometries at once.

Review your rooms in the *Table* to make sure the values are assigned correctly.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FEGxIfyqIdezhsWMwj2Uq%252FCreateRoom.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D593f8e6d-ce6e-426f-9485-f213633f0160&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=3cda822b&sv=2)

The values can always be edited either on *Home Page* or through the *Table.* You can change values for multiple Spaces at once.

If you want to add or edit Parameter set go to *Settings* -> *Edit parameters*. This is the same function as when setting up AreaSync for the first time through *Startup* view.

## Syncing to AreaSync web

In essence, synchronizing the data enables us to collaboratively share insights regarding the model's spaces with team members. It facilitates metric tracking, data visualization using tools like *Diagrammer* or PowerBi.

This functionality proves highly beneficial when providing project managers with an overview of spaces, reusing rooms during the transition to Revit, monitoring space changes over time, comparing various options, and effortlessly crafting diagrams for presentations.

To sync your model just simply click on *Sync (if sync is successful there will be a little pop-up window in right corner informing about how many rooms got synced)*:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F476H2Vk5bZf1e54GfOoq%252Fsync.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6028bda2-be1c-4367-ad5f-e59600d35882&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=764c10af&sv=2)

## Creating and compering Options

If we wish to track different Design Options in our model we can achieve that by organizing them by layers of Category parameter. Lets take a look at Design Options assigned to layers first:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FceQfVm1vDb1iPWN7XEs0%252Foptions.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Deffb1c4d-c308-4894-930e-1e7b41d51555&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8497d611&sv=2)

Once geometries are assigned to layers go back to *AreaSync* tab.

Click on *Use Options* button and *Add Option.*

First we need to create a new model for an Option or *Select Model* if it already had been created and synced in the past:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FxEQSkmfLNHy2Hj8Ecb0K%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De2709a61-9eca-4df0-9cd3-515abbb4fa8d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4d28981f&sv=2)

Next step is to specify whether the design options are differentiated by *Layers* or by Category parameter. If by layers then we need to select the relevant Layer containing specific Option:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FG6ghRqU2KWRTOCC7MbQR%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db627304d-fc25-499a-9bf6-fc77bd90f56b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=416d7542&sv=2)

To confirm just *Save* this design option. Repeat for all design options you wish to compare.

Once you setup the Design Options the view should look like this:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FFL6mCF20CX2pMMinczdJ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4f55252e-5f08-4929-a503-72023d7e141c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=20789f5&sv=2)

From here you can either *Edit* the design option settings or chose the once you wish to sync to AreaSync web. You can select which models you wish to sync (they will be highlighted in green) and click on *Sync*:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FHbHll7F7dKA1GR5ev0bQ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9ae84692-d5df-412b-bc05-43d36695d3ee&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1358a1d5&sv=2)

The entire workflow is as following:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FQEnDKU3mQbi17KdwNAmq%252FsyncOptions.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df07ed24a-d566-461f-9cd1-c54406333f51&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=489641a8&sv=2)

## Toggle tags

When working with plans *AreaSync* allows us to Tag the rooms.

Click on *Toggle Tags* to activate them:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FyPJ3kDdR3nXmAZM3P7Ml%252Ftogletags.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Daf378f5f-21e8-46d3-ade3-9f8771e24a62&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=60ed85df&sv=2)

Tags are fully customizable and are driven by the parameters assigned to spaces.

To edit the Tags go to *Settings* Tab -> *Tags Settings*. Here you can:

* **Bake Tags**: turn tags into text on your plans (NOTE: once tags are turned into text and you want to edit them you need to manually delete them, edit and then bake them again)
* **Display tags**: same as on the Home tab - just display tags
* **Font color**: chose color for tags
* **Font size**: edit size of the font
* **Parameters**: tick the parameters you want to display and rearrange them by drag and drop. You can also chose to display *Parameter Name*

Full workflow is as following:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FdX6ir7QERna2lDy3z9Nu%252Ftagsoptions.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbf32d724-df5c-4ef1-bd00-0af9301bd7d7&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6d39fa97&sv=2)

title: Settings Tab | AreaSync
content:
# Settings Tab

All additional and Startup View functions of AreaSync are hidden in Settings Tab. Let's take a look at them.

## Intro

Simply go to *Settings Tab* to access additional functions:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FuyNAOUDpVuLuIzllmCaA%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dcf9594ce-3d89-4c2f-ad54-02c334d0a231&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7b92dc7c&sv=2)

## Import Program

*Import Program* is the function from *Startup View,* in case you skipped thorough *Startup View* you can always access it from *Settings Tab.*

This function is in detail described in [this chapter.](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/upload-a-program-from-excel-and-generate-geometry)

NOTE: if you already have some parameters assigned to spaces in your model then if you upload a program your changes will be lost and overwritten with data coming from the program.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNXUghN1vn87RCdH7zq0h%252Falreadyhavedata.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D285a5e4b-512d-463b-bc02-7dc30d298f95&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c4384ca3&sv=2)

## Export program

Here you can simply export your data to Excel.

The data exported to Excel will be similar to *Table* in AreaSync - each instance of the space will be listed and paramters names will be used as column headers.

title: Sync your spaces to web | AreaSync
content:
# Sync your spaces to web

Share info about your spaces with other team members without opening Rhino. Syncing your model also allows you to make client facing dashboard in PowerBI.

## Syncing your model - entire walkthrough

## Sync your model

In order to sync the model, it needs to be connected to a Project from the HUB. You can see it in the left corner of the main page (here you can also switch to another project):

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F1m10yq0TuFsCetDiOU3c%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da1c3a3b0-eda2-4568-9756-180111a61b05&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=59ad8614&sv=2)

**If the Project is not there/incorrect Project is chosen please reach out to Digital Practice member to add you to correct one!** 
After the project is linked, to sync to AreaSync web, simply click on "Sync" on the Main page in Rhino:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FINnBJ0Sxe0OxAua4edcf%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D373d49bc-7fce-4703-974a-51a7616930bf&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5e2680b8&sv=2)

**What will the sync do?** 
Sync will send all the geometry of spaces + data associated to it to the cloud so you no longer need Rhino to display this data. Now you can access it through AreaSync web here: <https://areasync.perkinswill.com/>
**How often should I sync?** 
If you are actively working on the areas in the project is recommended to sync at least one per day. Even if you are not using AreaSync web or PowerBI, it contributes to benchmarking efforts across our company.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fg6oCdqG662Wd5DhgdPcZ%252Fswap_the_second_to_8662.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D49492451-ce20-493a-a4b2-7ade849637b6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=83cff1c8&sv=2)

## Navigating AreaSync web

Go to [www.areasync.com](https://areasync.perkinswill.com/) to learn more. [Here](/areasync/areasync.com) is the guide.

## How do I create a PowerBi dashboard for my project?

Please visit [this](/areasync/power-bi) page.

Before you sync, please go to Settings page:

Access Settings page

AreaSync will always sync Rooms and Areas but user can chose whether to *Include Linked Models* (it will grab all linked models) or *Sync Assets* (both options take a bit more time):

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FsSzR8vSOqEkksK0rpIEV%252F2025-02-07_14h42_04.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D41f14e6f-9c64-4a5a-93bf-d0917b352b92&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c011d8eb&sv=2)

# Model View

## Settings

The model viewer is where you can capture graphics to include in presentations or communications with the owner or project team. You can view exploded axon (default) or arrayed plans, and you can see these in the screenshot below. Also, note the Floor Spacing slider at the bottom of the menu.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FfNa5tT2i4vRL2pVYnDeH%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D598d6062-d9b5-432b-b030-5a4dbda77970&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=3226dcb5&sv=2)

title: Scenarios | AreaSync
content:
# Scenarios

Scenarios are valuable for estimating overall project room or area sizes and comparing them to targets, particularly in multimodel projects.

Scenarios are available on the Project Home View. After first sync Scenarios display total for Rooms.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F2jCQnCBoKK4s5rQDmHaZ%252F2025-01-30_11h32_36.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dba1e6173-caf9-409f-a992-cb9474e63eda&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4c831146&sv=2)

Access Scenarios on Project Home View

You are able to add and customize multiple Scenarios that are relevant for your project. Switching between scenarios affects The Area, Comparison with the Target, Pie Chart and Summary by parameter value.

To add new Scenario, click on Rooms -> Create New Scenario.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FBSAPYN8cWFm5sjNGwWcH%252F2025-01-30_11h39_42.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dafa61cd5-a069-4fe9-a3da-b4675f9dd8c5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d6b41a3a&sv=2)

Create new Scenario

Now we can customize the "Big Area Number" for particular scenario. In this example, the setting is done for Gross Area. As minimum you need to chose: Name for Scenario, Model, Space Type, Unit and Phase.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F9137HE5tQvSMwxBTNQc9%252F2025-01-30_11h41_59.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D63aae845-8543-4013-a19e-ebfb1b7266fe&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2beea3b2&sv=2)

Minimum required fields to setup new Scenario

Additionally, you can chose which Phase, Levels, to Exclude Unplaced Rooms and filter by specific value.

Filtering by value could be useful when you only want to display for example Internal Gross Area, excluding outdoor spaces and you already have this differentiation in the model.
Once the settings are chosen, click on Create.
As the result, when we switch to Gross Area scenario these values are displayed on the Project Home View:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Flz7AfZTeyxugUejaYFN9%252F2025-01-30_11h49_33.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db75a9a6a-79d5-4ce7-b2d4-63d59899f8b5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=879ee7e9&sv=2)

Accessing Scenarios
