content:
# Projects View

## Accessing Your Project

#### Open the [AreaSync Projects page](https://areasync.perkinswill.com/projects), and click the Open Projects button. Use the search bar in the top right to find your project. Click on your project to continue.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FWaUd39OCl7kDuWfjfxnj%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D668cf542-c124-4dd1-916b-1ba43cc9697c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=427022fc&sv=2)

## Info on the thumbnails. Where does it come from?

**Image:** Sourced from HUB App. To replace the image change it in the PW Projects page

**Name:** Sourced from HUB App, or custom entered from someone upon project creation.

**Green Check:** This appears if linked to HUB

**Last Sync:** The most recent sync from Revit or Rhino to the PW Project Database

*Some projects will show ‚ÄúNot Synced Yet‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúLast Sync‚Äù. In those Projects there is unfortunately nothing to view. If you are part of these projects please sync!*

## Don't see your project listed? Request from Digital Practice

Reach out to your local Digital Practice team member or request in the [General Teams channel](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/channel/19%3aa75859e05414409e80374ca03832a8ce%40thread.skype/General?groupId=ac84d985-c4f9-406d-9e5f-0487656c2178&tenantId=0669333e-dace-48e9-86a7-f105c21644e1). Provide the project name/number and the people that need to be added. Once the project has been created, refresh the page and search Projects again.

title: Start tracking Buildings | AreaSync
content:
# Start tracking Buildings

Before anything, think about what parameters the client or your team wants to keep control. Some examples are if you want to break your program in departments, or space functions, if they are public or not, how many desks a space need to fit.

## Define your parameters

Click on **Start Setup** and let‚Äôs start by defining the parameters we will keep track for this project. Parameter requires a name and a data type. AreaSync supports 4 data types of parameters:

* Text ‚Äì Useful to give name to things, or specify details.
* Number ‚Äì Assign quantities, minimums, maximums, targets, etc.
* Yes/no ‚Äì Specify ‚Äútrue/yes‚Äù or ‚Äúfalse/no‚Äù conditions.
* Category ‚Äì Classify things like departments, type of buildings, type of space, etc.

Parameters of type *Category* require a set of values (or classes) to categorize them. You can also assign colors for each category and add targets (normally targets are assigned per instance, but category type of parameter allows us to assign targets to group of instances e.g. Department).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FW3cMaKnO5Ert2RjlxN0C%252FAddParamrs.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddfadb229-b935-4538-94d8-67c58786ed62&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9ba2ec13&sv=2)

There are some parameters that are added to each room automatically:

* Name - name of the space/room (editable)
* Target Area - area in program (editable)
* Area - actual modelled area (non-editable)
* Coverage - % difference between **Target Area** and **Area**  (non-editable)

Alternatively, you can select parameters from preset. There are two presets available:

* Annual-Energy-Use - parameters needed for energy analysis
* AreaSync Revit - same parameters as the once available in the Revit template. This is recommended if you do not have requirements from the client and know that this project will be at some point moving to Revit.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F7lTXFYzpiZFhYC1QZPhk%252FAddParamrsSETUP.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc9b1ec2a-5edd-4028-ae87-81bd5abe34a7&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f865a42b&sv=2)

## Assign parameters to buildings

Lets apply our parameter set to our volumes geometry in Rhino. You just need to select the geometries you want to be considered as *Building*, select *Building* from dropdown and click *Select Geometry*.

You can select multiple volumes at once.

*Buildings* function allows you to assign *Heights* to your Volume. The total area of the building adds all *Heights* (levels) together. You can assign multiple *Heights* if your levels in our building differ.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FW5AD8jIxPFzkyxb30xSU%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd029b57d-0a82-43ec-b396-9b0ccaa86bd5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=63759a91&sv=2)

As the result we get a temporary levels that in the Building table show as one, total building:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FYky5NJKtH1wlnRJIQSFn%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbc12d6fc-5c79-418f-948c-c8e9d8116419&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9fcce054&sv=2)

The workflow of assigning the parameters to buildings looks as following:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FQiMNLVYQdoP9kVAofAT1%252Fbuildingsassigngeometry.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc5dfc9b2-5ce5-429b-8932-f1d3e2980e3c&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=82ff8f93&sv=2)

The values can always be edited either on *Home Page* or through the *Table.* You can change values for multiple Spaces at once:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhkcvYz5kU27c5IsSuQ5Y%252Fbuildigseditparam.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D824060f7-02c5-422e-beeb-6f9faf90858e&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=627fcca6&sv=2)

### Turn Buildings into Levels

At any point in time you can turn *Heights* into actual levels that will be dispalyed as *Rooms* in AreaSync.

To do that go to the *Buildings* table view, select buildings you want to turn into *Rooms (levels)* and select explode:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FXXu9BXFT25UqzajSIDc0%252FbuildigEXPLODE.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D130b22e5-635d-4248-9fbe-fe2330cbcbef&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=278ee313&sv=2)

The *Rooms* inherit parameter values that were assigned to *Buildings.*

[PreviousStart tracking Rooms](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/start-tracking-rooms)[NextUpload a program from Excel and generate geometry](/areasync/rhino/using-the-areasync-rhino-plugin/upload-a-program-from-excel-and-generate-geometry)

# Diagram Viewer

The Diagram Viewer contains a **model view** on the left and a **table view** of the data on the right side. The total area is reported at the bottom of the table. ## Color Schemes

title: Table View | AreaSync
content:
# Table View

The table view is where you want to **view and make changes to your project data**. That's right... in this table view within the Revit addin you can change individual cells or use some of the other features (find/replace, spell check, etc.) to edit multiple cells at once. Just click the little button in the middle of the vertical divider to write these changes back to the Revit file. Please note that you'll still need to sync back to central (in Revit) to save these edits back to the central model.

There are many other things you can do here, like change color palettes, filter to elements with warnings that aren't computing an area, export/import data with Excel, and save custom settings to a file to share with others.

## Add or Remove Columns

There are likely other pieces of data you would like to show from your models. Below you will see how to customize the table to show the data you need to see. See screenshot below on how to add or remove columns by checking or unchecking the buttons next to the parameter names.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FSlOKSZQxe6k5poZzSvSh%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D45e26538-2ff0-40b1-81cc-6a180f1db960&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=669567ae&sv=2)

Add/Remove Columns

## Filtering Columns

Now that you see your columns, you might want to filter some of those columns to trim down on the complexity or size of the data being shown. Click on right side of the column header and select Filter Results.

Next to each value, there is the eyeball icon on the left and the checkbox next to it. These are both on/off toggles. The eyeball toggles whether to make it visible in the 3D viewer, while the checkbox will toggle visibility in the table view. By unchecking the checkbox and making it invisible in the table view, it will be excluded from the total calculation at the bottom as well as the [export to CSV feature](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/diagram-viewer/table-view#export-to-excel)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FPyxhPggT4WNbVq8ktrOS%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7ac14820-7c33-4449-bcf8-5b52b4566e5b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=df12cad2&sv=2)

Filtering an individual column

## Find & Replace

This tool works like any other find/replace feature, but will only change the values *within a single column*. See below for how to navigate the interface. When you're done editing, just click the little button in the middle of the vertical divider to write these changes back to the Revit file.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhmkoHph1PFkRWJ2MWkZA%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De55f4089-b0d2-4563-9ed1-abbb8c942921&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=21a5d883&sv=2)

Find & Replace on an individual column

## Color By Column

One of the options when clicking on a column header is to color by column. This will change the shading color within the rows of the table view, while also coordinating with 3D view colors. Below, we can see the Level column be used to color the table and axon views.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FTFSDu5MMvtDcIZeI7cht%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dab667d95-1c28-4224-81ae-5e6ebe28624a&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f191857c&sv=2)

Color by column

This also changes the Chart View to match the column and colors.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fzrs85RtvaE5xs15tNyw5%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4c3b8b3d-1bdc-46a2-9461-0e2d67a8398d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c9544f11&sv=2)

Chart View

## Export to PowerBi

For getting specific visuals or counts/quantities from your Revit data, you'll want to connect your AreaSync project data to a PowerBi report using our [PowerBi template file on Sharepoint](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8). Please [download the current template file every time you start a new project](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8), as we are always making improvements to this file.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F2vr2EG7LrfbDRVSvJdWp%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D91569009-c67a-4ff9-a7fe-79e6c5e5165b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ac7816ad&sv=2)

Copies query token for PowerBi template

For next steps on what to do in PowerBi, check out our info on using PowerBi.

## Export to Excel

Some of us might be more comfortable editing this data in Excel, then pushing the changes back into Revit. AreaSync has export and import features to make this easy and convenient. Please remember that certain columns of data (Ex: Area) are read-only and won't be written back to the file during the Import process. See screenshot below to navigate the interface. Only the visible columns will exported.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FmOrdLQkqreBzy37oMQVB%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5fb1d397-abfd-47d2-aeab-909415bb8fa3&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8abac0ef&sv=2)

Export to CSV file

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F8L8v22iBi4knEPrRWvwB%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddf843677-3601-452f-9a66-b75bb9e43898&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7283db47&sv=2)

Automatically places the file in your Downloads folder

## Importing from Excel

So, you've made your changes to your data in Excel and you want to push those back into the Revit file. See screenshot below on how to get the dialog to select your XLSX or CSV file. Please remember that certain columns of data (Ex: Area) are read-only and won't be written back to the file during the Import process.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FyysMI5LjsKGjH35KjQz4%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De76627ab-6853-4275-97b8-deb0f188d1ca&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=bc0a1e3b&sv=2)

Import a XLSX or CSV file to make changes to Revit data

[PreviousDiagram Viewer](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/diagram-viewer)[NextModel View](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/diagram-viewer/model-view)

title: Project Users | AreaSync
content:
# Project Users

## User Roles

To keep the project organized we have implemented different roles for users. The first step is to add a user to a project as a Member which at minimum will allow them to sync and view. Here are the 3 roles below:

**Admin** ‚Äì Can sync to a project, create projects and add members. All DAM‚Äôs are admins by default.

**Manager** ‚Äì Can sync to a project, add members to a project. Recommended for Project Managers or BIM responsible.

**Member** ‚Äì Can sync to a project (and view). This will also show the latest commit per user.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FYNLyPQssY7Lq83JHCcyL%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4120d3a9-3956-4a9a-a813-d075321cb892&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1785eb34&sv=2)

## Adding a User

Click the Add Member button and start typing in the first name in the search bar. When you see the user name and email address as an option, select and click Add Member.

NOTE: If you don't see the users name to add, make sure they have followed the [instructions for the first time login](/areasync/revit/getting-started/first-time-login). If they haven't logged into areasync.com, you won't be able to add them.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNV9tPMyeLFEh8S2WWTYM%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2518cbf5-4eff-431e-abf2-be1d3ad8dc24&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5ae79a67&sv=2)

# The Syncs

After opening your project, you should see your total area from rooms along with a donut chart of that area. By default, the chart shows **Area by Department** but you can have it breakdown by any other room parameter.

## Latest Syncs

All previous syncs (also known as commits) to project are listed on the Project Home view below the Donut Chart.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FPeOlTxEkeUvNJCV3j7Cy%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0e5e9f5c-2e4f-4808-9cbc-6c8e685561aa&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6d216ebd&sv=2)

1. **Icon** - (a) Revit or (b) Rhino
2. **Commit/Model Name** - Name or autogen ID
3. **Time Since last Commit** - Shown in hours or days
4. **Synced By** - The user who synced to AreaSync
5. **View Commit in Diagram** - opens 3D Viewer (Diagrammr)
6. **Edit Commit** - Change Commit Name
7. **View Info** - Project Commit View

title: Generate geometry from Program in Revit | AreaSync
content:
# Generate geometry from Program in Revit

Create spaces in Revit directly from Excel.

### How to create spaces directly from Excel Program in Revit?

AreaSync program allows you to [upload the client Excel](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/project-home-view/upload-program-from-excel) (please follow the link to get guidance on how to upload the Excel) directly into web and from there use it in Revit to create spaces. There are 3 types of spaces we can create:
- Rooms
- Areas
- Blocks (Generic Model)
Before using this feature, first make sure the program is uploaded. Switch to *Program* on Main Page and make sure program is loaded (treemap is visible):

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fb9rB5GPOgE4byvwFnMfZ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5968a421-0a10-4d25-aa2a-9c28ad5a1372&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=99367a6a&sv=2)

Here is a basic overview of program features in Revit:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fj0nnx1N18YV2nrAW5R1N%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc955ce10-3dcb-4ea1-bc79-6710bb6692fa&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7ad9f703&sv=2)

## Treemap/table overview

There are two ways of viewing the program in Revit, both containing hierarchy:
-treemap - more visual way of displaying program items
-table
Click on the toggle to switch between them:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FsXCUOOxyFqi1UUvHFAH1%252Ftoggletreemap.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D031eb34a-b64c-4ddd-8f0b-3c13d18fa490&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=97faf15b&sv=2)

When working with ***treemap***:
- ***Single click*** selects the items, if you click on *Department* it will select all items within it
- ***Double click*** allows you to explore items in specific D*epartment*
- In order to trigger an action in Revit, click on ***Place*** above

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FnRjukYhxH3lR2MIoJsgF%252Fdobleclick.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D41a73ed4-9465-4b4f-8f12-9e373aac5928&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c80f5912&sv=2)

When working with ***table*** we can select all items or items from specific *Department* and/or *Sub-department*:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FA72YeBAe5ErD9lv2aFsE%252FtableClick.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd227b5da-fc16-4194-b1b0-32b97859fc60&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=230678df&sv=2)

**What does the program area colors mean?** 
Blue - modelled area is below target
Green - modelled area is on target
Red - modelled area is above target
Grey - program item not assigned to the model space
You can also color the spaces using brush icon to get visual indication if they are not target in relation to the program:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FOUHkoVIdJjxGevR7LvmI%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8e780575-9c96-4226-a822-6b3f56ab58f2&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d6940c08&sv=2)

## Create objects with program

This feature is useful when we start early conceptual phase in Revit. We can batch create all objects from program. AreaSync will create those spaces in the specified target size/count.

In program, click on 3 dots (*Settings*) and make sure right type of object is chosen (in the example we will be creating Rooms):

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FmkqME7qQZevypqn4vGZK%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da59fcf12-23c2-4a63-8ba5-5b6733c7a8f6&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=be545678&sv=2)

I**MPORTANT**: if you want to create Areas make sure you are in Area View (Area Views have to be created beforehand)
Then the Placement settings should be set to *Create objects with Program:*

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FWd66fuhAklEXmyVAgATi%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6a710ded-69d2-4f4d-86d2-2901c5e68502&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=a3c3d92d&sv=2)

Alternatively *right click* on treemap, chose object type and *Create objects with Program*:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FlaQ5jNdn0GPfNQqh1VdR%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D252d4164-1280-4779-9d59-c366075aef23&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=b0fd731e&sv=2)

Then select objects you would like to create in Revit from treemap (*Place* on the top indicates how many instances are selected/will be placed):

The final result:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FEXLYgSOqYOdqN0jVClnw%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8b5d8dc1-b63d-4d16-94ca-64c06d6e8a08&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=58298767&sv=2)

Here is the overview of entire flow with placing all rooms from program:

## Assign program to existing objects

If if already have a model with rooms/areas or blocks you can also assign program items to them. Before any assigment, make sure that correct object is selected, in this example we assign program items to rooms.
Then change ***Placement*** setting to ***Batch Assign Program:***

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F6vEKenfuEH8YYdzeJ7Ok%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da977a348-4952-44cf-ad8c-9e3853fe34ba&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=cc89bbdf&sv=2)

Then select item/multiple items from the program and click ***Place*** to assign them to existing objects in the model:

## Place space by point

Place by point is useful when the geometry is already modelled and we want to "drop" the space in specific place.
IMPORTANT: when selecting multiple items from program we do not have control over sequence of placement - therefore it is recommended by to place them one by one, unless there are the same items in the program e.g. 20 offices belonging to "Workspace" Department.

This settings works for all types of objects: areas, blocks and rooms. In this example we will be placing room.

First make sure that you are in the desired plan view.

Then select ***Place one program item at a time*** in ***Placement*** setting. Select item/items from the program that should be placed.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNUG1ql9AzjIXcFS75XUk%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da61e31ab-bfe3-44cb-92d1-e156efd7f2b3&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6dbf4827&sv=2)

Revit will be in placement mode until all the items selected are placed. Once all items are placed the notification will appear:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FCHQQlta3iJxrrl0EZ9qH%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd4aac1c5-dcea-43f1-85dd-379231bdef97&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=3aee374e&sv=2)

Here is the entire flow:

## Working with Blocks (Generic models)

Working with Blocks is useful when working on early concepts (without any geometry yet). Block is a Generic Model in Revit but through AreaSync it becomes traceable and is linked into Program. All same functions apply to blocks as to other space objects:

-Place one program item at the time
-Batch assign program items
-Create objects with program
If you wish to work with Blocks make sure this option is chosen in ***Placement*** setting:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FmCCbLkMxoIhtpF0343ks%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dfff7e372-cbb5-4bd0-b1dd-942643f22aca&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=e1913fa6&sv=2)

Currently, only supported shape is a square. When creating the ***Block*** its area is the same as the target.
Here is a flow of creating the blocks from ***Program***:

## Visualize

This feature allows us to visualize rooms in relation to the program. There are following options here:
- **Program** - color rooms and treemap by Department (there is an option to assign a custom color in Excel)
- **Area Target** - color rooms and treemap by modelled area target (Green: on target, Red: over target, Blue: below target, Grey: program item not assigned to the model space)
- **Count** - color rooms and treemap by target count (Green: on target, Red: over target, Blue: below target, Grey: program item not assigned to the model space)
- **Assigned** - color rooms and treemap to visually show if rooms are assigned to program or not (Green: assigned, without color: unassigned)
Toggle the ***Toggle Visualization*** icon to use this feature. By clicking on ***Toggle Visualization*** icon we can also chose by which criteria rooms should be colored:

## Visualize spaces in 3D

Clicking on ***Toggle Visualization*** Icon for the first time creates a 3D view in Revit where spaces can be viewed in 3D - they can be colored in the same way as in [Visualize](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/program/generate-geometry-from-program-in-revit#visualize) chapter. The view is called *"AreaSync*":

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FN3StKlkJ3KvNBiezTi97%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbd4f6caf-20c1-43ad-b6eb-7186e59a2b13&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=2ffd09c5&sv=2)

[PreviousProgram](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/program)[NextProject Info View](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/project-info-view)

title: Project Users | AreaSync
content:
# Project Users

## How to add the user to AreaSync?

## User Roles

To keep the project organized we have implemented different roles for users. The first step is to add a user to a project as a Member which at minimum will allow them to sync and view. Here are the 3 roles below:

**Admin** ‚Äì Can sync to a project, create projects and add members. All DAM‚Äôs are admins by default.

**Manager** ‚Äì Can sync to a project, add members to a project. Recommended for Project Managers or BIM responsible.

**Member** ‚Äì Can sync to a project (and view). This will also show the latest commit per user.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FYNLyPQssY7Lq83JHCcyL%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4120d3a9-3956-4a9a-a813-d075321cb892&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1785eb34&sv=2)

## Adding a User

Click the Add Member button and start typing in the first name in the search bar. When you see the user name and email address as an option, select and click Add Member.

NOTE: If you don't see the users name to add, make sure they have followed the [instructions for the first time login](/areasync/revit/getting-started/first-time-login). If they haven't logged into areasync.com, you won't be able to add them.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FNV9tPMyeLFEh8S2WWTYM%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2518cbf5-4eff-431e-abf2-be1d3ad8dc24&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=5ae79a67&sv=2)

title: Table View | AreaSync
content:
# Table View

The table view is where you want to **view your project data**.

There are many other things you can do here, like change color palettes, filter to elements with warnings that aren't computing an area, export/import data with Excel, and save custom settings to a file to share with others.

## Add or Remove Columns

There are likely other pieces of data you would like to show from your models. Below you will see how to customize the table to show the data you need to see. See screenshot below on how to add or remove columns by checking or unchecking the buttons next to the parameter names.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FSlOKSZQxe6k5poZzSvSh%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D45e26538-2ff0-40b1-81cc-6a180f1db960&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=669567ae&sv=2)

Add/Remove Columns

## Filtering Columns

Now that you see your columns, you might want to filter some of those columns to trim down on the complexity or size of the data being shown. Click on right side of the column header and select Filter Results.

Next to each value, there is the eyeball icon on the left and the checkbox next to it. These are both on/off toggles. The eyeball toggles whether to make it visible in the 3D viewer, while the checkbox will toggle visibility in the table view. By unchecking the checkbox and making it invisible in the table view, it will be excluded from the total calculation at the bottom as well as the [export to CSV feature](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/diagram-viewer/table-view#export-to-excel)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FPyxhPggT4WNbVq8ktrOS%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7ac14820-7c33-4449-bcf8-5b52b4566e5b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=df12cad2&sv=2)

Filtering an individual column

## Find & Replace

This tool works like any other find/replace feature, but will only change the values *within a single column*. See below for how to navigate the interface.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhmkoHph1PFkRWJ2MWkZA%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De55f4089-b0d2-4563-9ed1-abbb8c942921&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=21a5d883&sv=2)

Find & Replace on an individual column

## Color By Column

One of the options when clicking on a column header is to color by column. This will change the shading color within the rows of the table view, while also coordinating with 3D view colors. Below, we can see the Level column be used to color the table and axon views.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FTFSDu5MMvtDcIZeI7cht%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dab667d95-1c28-4224-81ae-5e6ebe28624a&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=f191857c&sv=2)

Color by column

This also changes the Chart View to match the column and colors.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252Fzrs85RtvaE5xs15tNyw5%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4c3b8b3d-1bdc-46a2-9461-0e2d67a8398d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=c9544f11&sv=2)

Chart View

## Export to PowerBi

For getting specific visuals or counts/quantities from your Revit data, you'll want to connect your AreaSync project data to a PowerBi report using our [PowerBi template file on Sharepoint](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8). Please [download the current template file every time you start a new project](https://perkinswillinc.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/DigitalPracticeFiles/Shared%20Documents/Digital%20Practice/DA%20Resources/AreaSync?csf=1&web=1&e=riJHE8), as we are always making improvements to this file.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F2vr2EG7LrfbDRVSvJdWp%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D91569009-c67a-4ff9-a7fe-79e6c5e5165b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ac7816ad&sv=2)

Copies query token for PowerBi template

For next steps on what to do in PowerBi, check out our info on using PowerBi.

## Export to Excel

Some of us might be more comfortable editing this data in Excel, then pushing the changes back into Revit. AreaSync has export and import features to make this easy and convenient. Please remember that certain columns of data (Ex: Area) are read-only and won't be written back to the file during the Import process. See screenshot below to navigate the interface. Only the visible columns will exported.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FmOrdLQkqreBzy37oMQVB%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5fb1d397-abfd-47d2-aeab-909415bb8fa3&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=8abac0ef&sv=2)

Export to CSV file

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F8L8v22iBi4knEPrRWvwB%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddf843677-3601-452f-9a66-b75bb9e43898&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7283db47&sv=2)

Automatically places the file in your Downloads folder

## Importing from Excel

So, you've made your changes to your data in Excel and you want to push those back into the Revit file. See screenshot below on how to get the dialog to select your XLSX or CSV file. Please remember that certain columns of data (Ex: Area) are read-only and won't be written back to the file during the Import process.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FyysMI5LjsKGjH35KjQz4%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De76627ab-6853-4275-97b8-deb0f188d1ca&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=bc0a1e3b&sv=2)

Import a XLSX or CSV file to make changes to Revit data

[PreviousDiagram Viewer](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/diagram-viewer)[NextModel View](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/diagram-viewer/model-view)

title: The Syncs | AreaSync
content:
# The Syncs

After opening your project, you should see your total area from rooms along with a donut chart of that area. By default, the chart shows **Area by Department** but you can have it breakdown by any other room parameter. Click the **Sync Now** button to transfer this room data to the cloud database.

## Latest Syncs

All previous syncs (also known as commits) to project are listed on the Project Home view below the Donut Chart.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FPeOlTxEkeUvNJCV3j7Cy%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0e5e9f5c-2e4f-4808-9cbc-6c8e685561aa&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=6d216ebd&sv=2)

1. **Icon** - (a) Revit or (b) Rhino
2. **Commit/Model Name** - Name or autogen ID
3. **Time Since last Commit** - Shown in hours or days
4. **Synced By** - The user who synced to AreaSync
5. **View Commit in Diagram** - opens 3D Viewer (Diagrammr)
6. **Edit Commit** - Change Commit Name
7. **View Info** - Project Commit View

title: Scenarios | AreaSync
content:
# Scenarios

Scenarios display the total area of Rooms or Areas in currently opened file. It does not include linked models.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FMo7q8Yypmlf5lrCSlpFf%252F2025-01-30_12h11_03.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D55c31318-1866-4333-9bb0-877d14994d0d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d0762bee&sv=2)

Switch between scenarios in the open file. Scenarios impact areas such as The Area, The Target, the Pie Chart, and the Summary Table.
Scenarios tagged "Revit" are available in the currently open file.
To view multi-model scenarios click on the one tagged "Web" and it will take you directly to this scenario in AreaSync Web. If you want to know how to setup new scenarios please read more [here](/areasync/areasync.com/navigating-areasync.com/project-home-view/scenarios).

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FecmZK8B8U5gWZoUBgViv%252F2025-01-30_12h13_18.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8d914e99-8083-471f-bf96-baf1968cc18b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=49011a12&sv=2)

title: HUB Link | AreaSync
content:
# HUB Link

As we encourage all active projects to be part of the HUB Projects page, we like to connect the HUB data to Area Sync 2. This is done upon Project Creation, and will pull in a cover image, Location, Program Type, Budget, and Areas. To go directly to the HUB page you can click the button that says ‚ÄúView on HUB‚Äù. If however your project is not currently liked to a HUB project and you want it to be, you can click the ‚ÄúLink to the HUB‚Äù button which will then allow you to search by name or by project number to connect it.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FVtmUXGMhQMRoAkmJXef5%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D043107a9-47f9-4298-93ac-47840bbb7492&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d493f430&sv=2)

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FjYhDdB8xaLFE1Orqcrdq%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D102e17d9-7146-4e8c-a4e3-752435ff784b&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=69e2c3e0&sv=2)

title: The Target | AreaSync
content:
# The Target

Target data is read from the Project App on Hub. You can access the AreaSync Project page to see details from HUB.

Metrics next to total area of rooms are driven by targets specified in **Size** on HUB, make sure that the correct target number is selected for your project. If you want to add another target go to HUB page of your project and add it under **Size.**

title: Upload Program from Excel | AreaSync
content:
# Upload Program from Excel

This feature allows us to directly upload the client's program from Excel and use it directly in Revit (similar like Wizard in Rhino).

## IMPORTANT!

Once you will upload Program to AreaSync, you can use it in Revit to create or assign data to:
-Rooms
-Areas
-Blocks (Generic Models)

Please check out [Program](/areasync/revit/using-the-areasync-revit-add-in/program/generate-geometry-from-program-in-revit) for guidance on how to place spaces in Revit.

## Getting template file

Open your model and go to **Quick Actions** on **Main Page.** Chose **Project Program.**

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FkixjYUjVyNakMMZzE1ix%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddf2492ec-8a5f-48cf-a97c-16f6aef3524a&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=48d4c665&sv=2)

It is likely that the Program in Excel you had recived from the client would have to be adapted to the AreaSync excel template file in order to be able to upload it. First step is to **Download Template.** You can also customize the columns in the template file by using **Add/Remove Columns** function.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FVQxolmeCvg5fucpzqTVH%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df8538178-fd33-4482-8b51-69bdf62c06b7&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=93d7b50c&sv=2)

The template file is essentially a really simple Excel that needs to be filled out with data coming from the clients program - in many cases you can semi-automate the process of filling out the data - contact your local DA for help.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FJ8ziyDcyW33LoPmdNMHj%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1e41a63a-9c1d-41f2-84a5-e996f1a6c252&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9988af5c&sv=2)

## Uploading an Excel program

Once you fill out the excel template save it. It should look something like this:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FRzgLKb6Txcx6ggCeN9eO%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2e9ccfc5-a7dc-4995-be3f-a84af2f47e85&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=559019be&sv=2)

You can now upload it to AreaSync by clicking **Import to Excel:**

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F5t5DzijX0SPNDRr7JHAR%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D09916132-330e-40d2-bc4b-5e570b7bb09d&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=1e648b32&sv=2)

On next page you can chose the Unit System and Color Pallette, then **Confirm and Sync to Cloud**:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252F7zzCKCsp3rnQgwIfVSnW%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6fba2c73-a5bc-4330-84c6-06fe42b702ab&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=7d08e698&sv=2)

Uploaded program will look like this:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FRkW3dqXDGpTAoX8CWDeT%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D84f092d0-68b4-47c4-b1ad-233305932901&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=ea2c5fbe&sv=2)

Here is a recording of entire process step by step:

## Editing program

Program can be edited in two ways:

1. Through Excel
2. Directly in web

In both cases, on the Program page switch to **Edit Program**

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FhP1FGgclWaausqgXSEYb%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0052fc83-dde2-4635-b8f6-399f725164f5&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=d13ef8c8&sv=2)

## Editing program with Excel

**This way is recommended if we need to do batch edits to the program.
Export** program to get it back to Excel - that way we keep the consistency between inputs and outputs.

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FdhFtMcwdsmow1RYa7VhY%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddb95d168-43ab-4e38-bada-5e200e61b630&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=4b274fa7&sv=2)

Edit the Excel file and save it. In this example *Department* name was switched from "*UA1. Social spaces and restaurantion"* to "*Social*" and "*UA2. Workspace*" to "*Workspace*".
Then use *Import* to overwrite the changes in AreaSync:

AreaSync compares current program to imported one. Changes in Program are color coded:
- Removed - Red
- Edited - Yellow
- New - Green
Review changes and click *Save* (your program will be overwritten)*:*

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FMfJqXUCS0dMplpgEBbVV%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D18454dc2-d3a8-4ae6-b459-8e076b546558&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9395fb5d&sv=2)

## Editing program in AreaSync web

AreaSync web allows us to do same operations as in Excel, we can:
-Delete items - click on 3 dots and *Delete* to remove row
-Edit items - click on 3 dots on the row and chose *Edit,* we can edit parameter values as well as count or targets
-Add New items - to add new item simply click on *Add item.*

Make sure to *Save* the changes after editing:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FMfJqXUCS0dMplpgEBbVV%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D18454dc2-d3a8-4ae6-b459-8e076b546558&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=9395fb5d&sv=2)

## Dashboard View

Once the program is uploaded it can be viewed on the dashboard. Dashboard gives an overview of Modeled vs. Target Areas. It can be displayed by Parameter (hierarchical parameter from the Program) and filtered by specific parameter value:

![](https://perkinswill.gitbook.io/areasync/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F2972092245-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FEOcmt9bd4wZniFl6IIkP%252Fuploads%252FvXi7zsZ60EzMa65fv1tD%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1a620369-41c3-4c6a-b6dd-08a9cfc86a15&width=768&dpr=3&quality=100&sign=79311cf3&sv=2)
